Our Work

Products & Open Source

Everything we build — from SaaS products to open source tools. All built by one developer with AI.

Products

Fitnito

Live

Simple gym scheduling for independent gym owners. Built in late 2023 to replace an overpriced enterprise tool — now helping gyms across Canada save money and actually enjoy their software. Classes, clients, passes, recurring sessions — everything a gym needs, nothing it doesn't.

fitnito.com → Read the story

Healthware

In Development

Healthcare is stuck in the past, and AI might be the thing that finally drags it forward. Healthware is our lab for exploring that — a set of experimental apps that use AI to make health information actually accessible to normal humans. Some will be useful, some will be interesting failures. All of them will be more modern than whatever your doctor's office is running.

First up: a medication interaction checker that doesn't look like it was built in 2003.

healthware.ca →

Fitify

Live

Fitness for people who hate fitness. Daily tips that trick you into exercising by disguising workouts as regular life. Walk your dog? Cardio. Carry all the groceries in one trip? Farmer's carry. Rage-clean your kitchen? 200 calories torched.

Built with Rails 8 and 139 sneaky tips across 13 categories. Zero guilt, sassy not mean. Personalized tips, streak tracking, and a shareable tip library.

fitify.ca →

Open Source

We open source the tools we build for ourselves. If they're useful to us, maybe they're useful to you.

DashBot

MIT

Real-time dashboard for AI agents. Chat with your agent, monitor status, and interact with agentic cards — from any browser. Built with Rails 8, React 19, and Action Cable.

Ruby · TypeScript · React · SQLite

dashbot-openclaw

MIT

OpenClaw plugin that connects your AI agent to DashBot. Handles chat, status reporting, and agentic cards over WebSocket.

TypeScript · Vitest · Action Cable

wemble.com

MIT

This website. A Jekyll static site served via Docker and nginx on Dokku. Clean, fast, no JavaScript frameworks required.

Jekyll · Tailwind CSS · Docker · nginx
View all on GitHub →
